content.description: Far left route on the lower dome section. Has 2 bolts down low and then a long run out slab climb to the 3rd bolt. Rappel or scramble right on ledge. Ground fall possible before clipping 3rd bolt.
content.location: Far left route on the lower dome section

content.description: Far right route on the lower dome. Rappel or scramble right off ledge. Fun start and slaby finish. A few hand and feet jams in the middle.
content.location: Far right route on the lower dome.

content.description: A very easy dihedral that slants to the right. Half way up it is easy face climbing to the top. Hike down to the right. I heard from a climbing bud that "We climbed this free solo for fun. It could be useful for a person new to trad climbing."
content.protection: Rack of nuts and cams. 3 belay bolts on top.
content.location: A very easy dihedral that slants to the right. Half way up it is easy face climbing to the top. Hike down to the right.

content.description: Third climb from the left on the upper dome. Starts just to the right of a large tree. The crux is near the second bolt. Slab climb after the 4th bolt and pro can be placed in the crack to the left or right. Crumbly rock. Rappel or hike up and right. Took some time to get to and past the second bolt. Well protected, and rated G.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 3 belay bolts. About 3 mid size cams needed.
content.location: Third climb from the left on the upper dome. Starts just to the right of a large tree. The crux is near the second bolt.
